ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: the professor knows a TON and delivers huge amounts of information very casually. hard to know what to really zero in onand take notes about- but he's a SMART DUDE.
I would like to comment that this course will be useful to everyone working in the environmental field.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Gaining familiarity with the language of law and comfortability with discussing levels of policy (statute, manual, regs etc)
Evolution of the environmental law
Lecture sessions
The range of readings covered in class.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: More external readings besides statutes?
It would be helpful if the professor had accompanying materials (i.e. powerpoint slides). He just talked for about 3 hours every Friday straight and it was difficult to keep up.
Discussions time need to be extended a bit
Few assignments would be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: NA

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: One of the few core enviro policy courses offered.
I have a legal background so this is a perfect course to me to compare and analyze differences and similarities between laws in my country with that of the US

Gaining an understanding of how laws are formulated and how they are impacted by stakeholders and the rational behind formulations behind such laws will help me greatly in understanding how laws are being formulated and managed in my country.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Gotta gain fluency with real enviro law.
As a Public Health student concentrating in Environmental Health Sciences, I thought it would be helpful to learn about environmental law.
To understand more on US environmental law
I work in Legislature and policy formulation and i wanted to learn how environmental law has been formulated in the US.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yes
I am not sure if I learned anything. The entire course was a bit scattered.
Yes.
Yes, it did esp. i found clean Air Act and Clean water act very interesting
Yes
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: There was no group work

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take notes, show up, and be ready to think critically. Take the professor's ego with a grain of salt.
I strongly recommend this course to everyone
